algorithm_technique: Check the parity of the character's position and the digit's position to determine the square's color.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a chessboard square at given coordinates is white or black.
problem_summary_technical: Calculate color based on the parity of the column (letter) and row (number) indices.
key_insights: Chessboard coloring follows a pattern based on the sum of row and column indices.
If the sum of the 0-indexed row and column is even, the square is one color; if odd, it's the other.
The parity check `(ord(coordinates[0])-ord('a'))%2 != (ord(coordinates[1])-ord('1'))%2` efficiently determines if the parities of column and row differ, indicating a white square.
